title: Costa Rica becomes the first Central American country to legalize same-sex marriage
description: Marriage equality is now law in Costa Rica.

title: She was tricked as a teen into prostitution. Now she faces starvation
This is what touring Spain this summer could look like
description: CNN's Atika Shubert reports on plans underway in Spain to ease foreign travel restrictions in an effort to welcome back tourists, despite concerns over Covid-19.

title: Watch landing of last resort in virus hotbed
description: Planes are bringing some of the sickest Covid-19 patients from hundreds of miles away to Manaus, Brazil's hardest-hit city. CNN's Nick Paton Walsh reports.

title: Joe Biden responds to Trump on masks: 'He's a fool'
description: In an interview with CNN's Dana Bash, Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden hit back at President Donald Trump over wearing a mask, and his ability to lead the country.

title: What Biden says about potential running mate
description: In an interview with CNN's Dana Bash, Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden said he was considering choosing a woman of color as his running mate, but was also considering other candidates.

title: CNN's Brianna Keilar pushes state official on his promise to Trump
description: After President Trump has repeatedly railed on mail-in voting, Alabama Secretary of State John Merrill tweeted that his state would not allow mail-in ballots but would provide absentee ballots for those who do not feel safe voting at the poles due to the coronavirus.

title: White woman who called police on a black man bird-watching in Central Park has been fired
description: The white woman who called police on a black man in Central Park during an encounter involving her unleashed dog has been fired from her job, her employer said Tuesday.

title: A space launch 'saved' 1968. If only it could do the same for 2020
description: In 1968, the pioneering Apollo 8 lunar orbit mission lifted America's morale in a bitter year of political assassinations, race and anti-war riots, the fading presidency of Lyndon Johnson and a hardening Cold War.

title: France to inject almost $9 billion into ailing auto industry
description: French President Emmanuel Macron has announced an $8.8 billion aid package for the country's embattled auto industry, which has seen sales tank during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: People are buying lots of booze, but global alcohol sales are still tanking
description: People are buying a lot of booze, but it's not enough to prevent an overall downturn that will take the industry several years to recover.

title: Virgin Orbit rocket cuts short crucial test flight
description: Virgin Orbit experienced a hiccup Monday with the launch demo of its two-stage orbital rocket from a 747 aircraft.

title: Behind-the-scenes of the American South's growing indy film industry
description: In the past decade the American South has become a nexus of film production. Over a year ending summer 2019, $2.9 billion was invested into Georgia alone, as a result of productions choosing to film in the state.

title: The asteroid that wiped out the dinosaurs hit at 'deadliest possible' angle
description: The city-size asteroid that hit Earth 66 million years ago and doomed the dinosaurs to extinction came from the northeast at a steep angle, maximizing the amount of climate-changing gases unleashed into the atmosphere, a new study has found.

title: Denmark allows cross-border 'sweethearts' to reunite -- on one condition
description: Lockdowns and social distancing restrictions have pushed couples apart around the world. But Denmark is now allowing some citizens in cross-border relationships to reunite with their partners.

title: Pentagon deputy inspector general resigns, becomes latest watchdog to exit administration
description: A top internal watchdog at the Pentagon, Glenn Fine, submitted his resignation Tuesday, more than a month after President Donald Trump effectively removed him as chairman of the Pandemic Response Accountability Committee, a group of independent watchdogs tasked with overseeing $2 trillion in emergency coronavirus funding.

title: Video shows bear following boy during a family hike
description: An Italian boy named Alessandro was captured on video while he was being followed by a brown bear during a hike with his family.

title: Europe's rebound from coronavirus is threatened
description: A fight over how to fund the European Union's recovery from the coronavirus pandemic is stoking tensions between wealthier and poorer countries, threatening to delay the region's economic rebound and unleash political and financial forces that could pull the bloc apart.

title: CNN's John King crunches US coronavirus numbers as states reopen
description: CNN's John King looks at the numbers around the coronavirus pandemic across the US as states begin the process of reopening.

title: Dutch leader did not visit dying mother for weeks to comply with lockdown rules
description: Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte was unable to visit his mother in the weeks leading up to her death due to coronavirus restrictions, but he did stay with her on her final night, his spokesman told CNN Tuesday.

title: Massive saber-toothed anchovies once existed. Yes, anchovies
description: The anchovies we know today are small, plankton-eating fish that often flavor our Caesar salads and pizzas.

title: Gucci abandons 'worn-out ritual' of fashion seasons as the industry looks inward
description: Gucci's creative director Alessandro Michele has announced that the brand is permanently abandoning the traditional fashion calendar as the industry rethinks how it operates in the light of Covid-19.

title: Stanley Ho, Hong Kong billionaire and Macao's 'godfather of gambling,' dies at 98
description: Stanley Ho, Macao gambling tycoon and one of Hong Kong's first billionaires, has died at the age of 98, his family said on Tuesday.

title: 13-year-old boy earns four associate's degrees
description: A 13-year-old boy in California has graduated from college with four associate's degrees.

title: A wrongfully convicted man freed after 36 years is now an 'America's Got Talent' favorite
description: The new season of "America's Got Talent" already has a frontrunner, and his episode hasn't even aired yet. But he's got a story -- and a voice -- for the ages.

title: Masks are too dangerous for children under two, Japanese experts warn
description: Wearing masks has become increasingly common during the coronavirus pandemic, but they should not be used by children under the age of two, according to the Japan Pediatric Association.

title: Flight to Italy resumes only to find airport shut when it gets there
description: We're all pretty excited about being able to travel again -- but German airline Eurowings might be more eager than most.

title: This country seemed to do everything right. So how did it become a Covid-19 hotspot?
Japan to discuss cyberbullying laws after death of wrestler
description: Japanese government officials are calling for action against cyberbullying, amid a national outpouring of grief after the death of professional wrestler and reality television star Hana Kimura.

title: Latin America's largest airline files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy
Ahmaud Arbery killing being investigated as federal hate crime, family attorney says
description: S. Lee Merritt, an attorney for the family of Ahmaud Arbery, told CNN on Monday that the US Department of Justice is investigating the shooting death as a hate crime.

title: This Chinese city wants to score and rank its residents based on their health
description: Imagine a smartphone app that has access to your medical records and assigns you a daily score based on your preconditions, recent checkups and lifestyle habits -- how much you've drunk, smoked, exercised and slept on any given day can all affect your points total, boosting or lowering your ranking.

title: Discrimination towards Africans in China goes back decades
description: A black version of the Chinese flag swept across African Twitter earlier this month, as users replaced their avatars to express their anger at the government of China.

title: Some Americans take a holiday from social distancing
description: At a glance, it may look like many Americans have long forgotten about the dangers of coronavirus.

title: Boris Johnson's aide defends lockdown trip amid UK scandal
description: Boris Johnson's embattled chief aide has defended his decision to drive across England during lockdown, amid a scandal over his movements that has overshadowed the UK government's coronavirus response.

title: Trump may be tiptoeing toward a break with Xi
description: The last time the US and China reached a point of confrontation over Hong Kong, President Donald Trump had a strong incentive to play it cool. Now, as China tries to impose a new security law on the territory, the opposite may be the case.
